intro: Galium sylvaticum subsp. laevigatum, commonly known as smooth woodcrushers, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Its subspecies name, *laevigatum*, refers to the smooth texture of its stems.
